citation.article-title: Cellulolytic and dextranolytic Gram-negative bacteria: revival of the genus Cellvibrio.

p.s: Description of Cellvibrio mixtus subsp. mixtus subsp. nov.
Cellvibrio mixtus subsp. mixtus (mix.tus, M.L. masc. adj. mixtus mixed, referring to the type of flagellation)
Description: Acid is produced from cellobiose and melezitose and the enzymes β-glucuronidase and β-galactosidase are produced.
Most strains hydrolyse tributyrin (89%), produce aminopeptidase activity (89%) and are soluble in 3% KOH (100%) and 10% sodium lauryl sulphate (78%).
The moles % G + C of the type strain as determined by thermal denaturation is 52.6.
